value.title: 3 REASONS to use a single dataset for your Power BI reports
value.excerpt: Are you copying your Power BI Dataset or PBIX multiple times? Here are 3 reasons why you shouldn't be doing that.  Christopher Wagner Article: https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/dataflows-datasets-power-bi-christopher-wagner-mba/  ExceleratorBI article: https://exceleratorbi.com.au/new-power-bi-reports-golden-dataset/

value.title: Dynamic titles with multiple slicers or filters in Power BI
value.excerpt: We've talked about dynamic titles in Power BI before. But, what if you wanted to combine multiple values into that dynamic title. Patrick shows you how using a little DAX!  Download Sample: https://guyinacu.be/dynamictitlesample  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************

value.title: Looking at Power BI Many to Many
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick takes a look at Power BI Many to Many relationships. This was part of the July 2018 Power BI Desktop release and can enable some awesome capabilities. Patrick looks at why you may not want to use Power BI Many to Many even though you think you do.  Many to Many documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/desktop-many-to-many-relationships

value.title: Modern Data Lakehouse? Where do you even start??? Azure Synapse of course!

value.title: Power BI dataflows vs datamarts: What's the difference???

Introduction to datamarts https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/transform-model/datamarts/datamarts-overview  Comparing dataflows to datamarts

value.title: Power BI Tutorial | From Flat File To Data Model
value.excerpt: In this Power BI Tutorial, Patrick looks at how to load data from a flat file to the data model. This could be a text, csv or excel file with a lot of columns. Don't just pull it into Power BI. Take time to structure your data in your data model. From flat file to data model is basic concept, but is

value.title: How to Set Up Power BI Gateway to Connect to On-Premise Data in Enterprise Mode
value.excerpt: Power BI Gateway acts as a bridge to let PowerBI.com (Cloud) connect to your On-Premise (Local) Data Sources – like local Excel Files or a local SQL Server. value.title: Count of Unique Values DistinctCount in Power BI Through Power Query Group By Transformation
value.excerpt: You can have a distinct count calculation in multiple places in Power BI, through DAX code, using the Visual's aggregation on a field, or even in Power Query. If you are doing the distinct count in Power Query as part of a group by operation, however, the existing distinct count is for all columns in

value.title: Sort a Column with a Custom Order in Power BI
value.excerpt: I have previously written about how to sort a column by another column, and I used Month Names as an example. However, still, many are unaware that the same technique with slight modifications can be applied to any other columns. You can have a text column in your slicer (product category for example),

value.title: Computing rolling average in DAX
value.excerpt: Computing the rolling 12-months average in DAX looks simple, but it hides some level of complexity.  This article explains how to write the best formula and how to avoid common pitfalls using time intelligence functions. Article and download: https://sql.bi/15161?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt

value.title: Computing totals by summing visible values in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to compute a measure that sums the values produced row by row in the visual into the visual total, instead of recomputing the total value in the filter context of the total. Article and download: https://sql.bi/89870

value.title: Specifying multiple filter conditions in CALCULATE
value.excerpt: The filter arguments in CALCULATE can reference multiple columns from the same table in a single predicate: This is possible since March 2021 in Power BI, before that it was possible to filter a single column reference.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/705207?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt

value.title: Clean, transform, and load data in Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how to clean, transform, and load data in Power BI.

value.title: Use visuals in Power BI
value.excerpt: Create and customize visuals to present data in compelling and insightful ways.

value.title: Work with Power BI visuals
value.excerpt: Learn how to choose from the exceptional visuals that Power BI makes available to you. Formatting visuals will direct the user’s attention to exactly where you want it, while helping to make the visual easier to read and interpret. You will also learn about how to use key performance indicators (KPIs).
